security: The document contains information that could reveal intelligence sources and methods related to monitoring anti-Castro activities. Disclosing specific details about informants and their locations could compromise their safety and the effectiveness of ongoing intelligence operations. As the document states, 'This group must be penetrated.'
summary: A National Security Agency (NSA) report from January 16, 1963, relays information about a reported plot to assassinate Fidel Castro, as communicated by an informer in Pinar del Rio, Cuba.
summary_one_paragraph: This NSA report, dated January 16, 1963, details a potential plot to assassinate Fidel Castro. According to the report, an informer named Ruben Maqueria, known as MATEIBO, mentioned in a conversation at Central José Marti, his place of residence, that assassinating Castro on El Cocuyo Road would be a good idea. The information was reported by Juan Taboada, who overheard the conversation. The report suggests that the group involved should be penetrated to gather more information.
title: 2/0/CUK/T05-63: PLOT TO ASSASSINATE CASTRO REPORTED [R]
